column4: I dont know whats so weird about the kernbel images tin apt for ubuntu but vmware doesnt seem tot hink any kind of kernel souce is good for building against them.
I have vmware up and running...
you should install the kernel-headers corrisponding to your kernel image... the vmware installer should automatically guess the righ source (/lib/modules...)
what is the directory that you gave for kernel include files?
this is the path I specified "/lib/modules/2.6.8.1-3-k7/build"
I use k7 optimized kernel... change k7 for what you are running...
it seems that you are not listening...
would you allow me to try to help you?
could you please check the file /usr/src/linux-headers-2.6.8.1-3-686-smp/include/linux/version.h and check if UTS_RELEASE match you uname version?
you could try to change it...
still says its the worng version
